meaningMnemonic: Tying a <radical>thread</radical> to a <radical>tombstone</radical> each year will help you <kanji>manage</kanji> the <kanji>passage of time</kanji>. That way you’ll know how many years you <kanji>pass through</kanji>, since you’ll have one thread for each year to count.
readingMnemonic: Dealing with the <kanji>passage of time</kanji> can be tough, so after you tie the thread to the tombstone, each year you eat a piece of <reading>ca</reading>ke (けい). You already eat cake to mark the passage of time on your birthday, so why not here as well?
